headline: NYSE Plans Blockchain Venue for 24/7 Tokenized Stock Trading
summary: Exchange owner ICE is seeking SEC approval to launch real-time trading and settlement for tokenized stocks and ETFs later this year.

headline: Markets: What's lighting a 'fire' under small-cap stocks?
summary: Rockland Trust first vice president and portfolio manager Karl Farmer discusses the outlook on small-cap stocks (^RUT, IWM) amid the recent rally, while also commenting on the prospects for Intercontinental Exchange stock (ICE). Also hear Karl Farmer's forecast for the Federal Reserve's projected interest rate cuts in 2026. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: NYSE Builds Tokenized Platform. It’s Another Step Toward 24/7 Trading.
summary: The exchange is seeking regulatory approval for what it calls a “tokenized securities platform.” Here’s what that means.

raw.headline: NYSE Builds Tokenized Platform. It’s Another Step Toward 24/7 Trading.
raw.summary: The exchange is seeking regulatory approval for what it calls a “tokenized securities platform.” Here’s what that means.

headline: NYSE-parent Intercontinental Exchange develops platform for 24/7 tokenized securities trading
summary: Intercontinental Exchange said on Monday that it had developed a platform for trading ​and on-chain settlement of tokenized securities, in a move ‌to capitalize on global demand for U.S. equities.  NYSE’s new digital platform - for ‌which it will seek regulatory approvals - will enable 24/7 operations, instant settlement, orders sized in dollar amounts, and stablecoin-based funding, the exchange said.  Investor appetite for nonstop trading in U.S. stocks has ⁠spiked in recent ‌years, which has prompted regulators to introduce new rules and approve proposals from major exchanges to ‍enable trading beyond normal market hours.

Investor appetite for nonstop trading in U.S. stocks has ⁠spiked in recent ‌years, which has prompted regulators to introduce new rules and approve proposals from major exchanges to ‍enable trading beyond normal market hours.

headline: Beat the Market the Zacks Way: Amicus, Micron, Amgen in Focus
summary: FOLD, MU and AMGN delivered sharp gains as Zacks strategies beat key benchmarks despite tariff fears, policy uncertainty and volatile markets.

headline: The New York Stock Exchange Develops Tokenized Securities Platform
summary: NEW YORK, January 19, 2026--The New York Stock Exchange, part of Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. (NYSE: ICE), a leading global provider of technology and data, today announced its development of a platform for trading and on-chain settlement of tokenized securities, for which it will seek regulatory approvals.
